margin: 12px auto; padding: 0px; color: rgb(28, 28, 28); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 18px;">The day after I made my very first <a href="https://www.kawalingpinoy.com/gising-gising/" style="box-sizing: inherit; background-color: transparent; transition: all 400ms ease 0s; color: rgb(161, 98, 69); font-weight: 700;">gising-gising</a>, I packed half of it to work for one of my co-workers to try. She is from Bicol, and I was interested to know what she thought of my newfound recipe. Alas! Instead of the rave review I expected, she barely touched the portion I ladled on her plate.</p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; margin: 12px auto; padding: 0px; color: rgb(28, 28, 28); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 18px;">The next day in the break room, she plopped a big Tupperware in front of me and said, "<em style="box-sizing: inherit;">This is how you do spicy. Go big or go home.</em>" Oh. My. Gaawwd! Her Bicol Express was so viciously hot I couldn't feel my tongue after each bite and yet it was so deliriously good I kept digging in for more!</p><div id="AdThrive_Content_1_desktop" class="adthrive-ad adthrive-content adthrive-content-1 adthrive-ad-cls up-show" data-google-query-id="CK6azdT32IADFXJXnQkdzJ0Juw" style="box-sizing: inherit; margin: 12px auto; padding: 0px; color: rgb(28, 28, 28); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 18px;">I first posted my version of this dish in May 2014, but although it has received great reviews from our readers, I am updating it now with a few changes. I wanted the recipe to be as authentic as possible, and after researching online and asking all my Bicolano friends for guidance, I think the new method below comes pretty close.</p><div class="wp-block-image" style="box-sizing: inherit; margin-top: 16px; margin-right: auto; margin-left: auto; padding: 0px; color: rgb(28, 28, 28); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; margin-bottom: 0px !important;"><figure class="aligncenter size-full" style="box-sizing: inherit; margin-right: auto; margin-left: auto; clear: both; display: table; width: 730px; margin-bottom: 0px !important;"><img decoding="async" width="1200" height="1600" data-pin-description="Bicol Express is the ultimate comfort food! 0s; opacity: 0; cursor: pointer; transform: none;"><span style="box-sizing: inherit; display: block; background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.7); height: fit-content; width: fit-content; top: 0px; left: 0px; color: rgb(68, 68, 68); font-size: 10px; font-weight: bold; font-family: sans-serif; line-height: normal; margin: 0px; padding: 6px; border-radius: 0px 0px 5px;">AD</span></div></div></div><p style="box-sizing: inherit; margin: 12px auto; padding: 0px; color: rgb(28, 28, 28); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 18px;">One of the changes I made to my previous recipe is adding about 2 cups of sliced finger chilis along with the 14 reasonably large red Thai chili peppers (siling labuyo), and the result is definitely not one for the meek. My mouth was seriously on fire while I was eating the savory pork for lunch today!</p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; margin: 12px auto; padding: 0px; color: rgb(28, 28, 28); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 18px;">You can decrease the number of peppers or scrape the seeds off the pods before mincing if you want to tone down the spice, but as my Bicolana friend said, it's NOT Bicol Express if it's not numbing your tongue. In fact, the authentic Bicol version uses more chili than pork!</p><p style="box-sizing: inherit; margin: 12px auto; padding: 0px; color: rgb(28, 28, 28); font-family: Lato, sans-serif; font-size: 18px;">If you want the same creamy flavors but with a friendlier heat, you can try this <a href="https://www.kawalingpinoy.com/binagoongan-baboy-sa-gata/" style="box-sizing: inherit; background-color: transparent; transition: all 400ms ease 0s; color: rgb(161, 98, 69); font-weight: 700;">binagoongan baboy sa gata</a> instead.</p><p><br></p>
